means: 塔拉瓦岛 （西太平洋岛国基里巴斯的主岛）

sentence.Network_en: With Tarawa eliminated, the way was clear for attack on the Marshall Group.
sentence.Network_cn: 塔拉瓦据点被解决后, 向马绍尔群岛进攻的道路便平坦无阻了.

sentence.Network_en: Two uninhabited Kiribati islands, Tebua Tarawa and Abanuea, disappeared underwater in 1999.
sentence.Network_cn: 基里巴斯国的两个无人岛特布·塔拉瓦和阿巴尼亚在1999年被海水淹没,已经消失了.

list.abs: 巴卡卡 bakaka北塔拉瓦 tarawa north4,477

means.word_mean: 2. battles in World War II in the Pacific (November 1943); United States Marines took the islands from the Japanese after bitter fighting

auth_sentence.content: "If we thought Tarawa was bad, for the way the Japanese had dug themselves in, Iwo was the worst of them all," he said.
auth_sentence.res_content: "If we thought Tarawa was bad, for the way the Japanese had dug themselves in, Iwo was the worst of them all," he said.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: "If we thought Tarawa was bad, for the way the Japanese had dug themselves in, Iwo was the worst of them all," he said.

auth_sentence.content: On November 20, 1943, the Allies set their sights on Tarawa, a coral atoll in the central Pacific near the equator.
